Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • Actor
      • Enemy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Solid
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EnemyStrong

    public class Enemy
extends Actor
    An Enemy represents anything in Mater Tua that can deal damage to the Player, and that the Player must kill to advance. Enemies cannot damage each other.
    Author:
    eugenia
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(int x,
             int y)
        Creates an Enemy object that is facing up. Its "hitbox" used for collision detection has its top left corner at (x, y), and its width is 10 pixels. It has 100 HP and an attack value of 6.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of hitbox's top left corner
        y - y coordinate of hitbox's top left corner

    • Method Detail

      • moveTowards

        public void moveTowards(java.util.ArrayList<Solid> solids,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        Moves this Enemy towards the given location (x, y).
        Parameters:
        solids - the other Solids on the screen
        x - x coordinate of this Enemy's target location
        y - y coordinate of this Enemy's target location

      • skill2

        public void skill2(java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> projectiles,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Solid> solids)
        Performs this Enemy's 2nd skill, which fires a high-power Projectiles in all 4 directions.
        Parameters:
        projectiles - the other projectiles in the game
        solids - the other solids on the screen

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if the specified object is an Enemy (for level completion determination purposes), false otherwise.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the other Object this Enemy will be compared to

        Parameters:
